channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: North Korea allegedly executes 30 government officials for flood failures
item.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un is reported to have executed at least 30 officials for their failure to prevent devastating summer floods that killed thousands. The North Korean Central News Agency confirmed Kim's orders for strict punishment. Despite offers of aid from neighboring countries, North Korea has refused assistance.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why China keeps ramming Philippine ships and where that’s headed
item.description: Tensions in the South China Sea have escalated as China's coast guard clashes with Philippine vessels. The conflict, centered around the Sabina Shoal, has drawn global attention and involves multiple Asian countries. The US, bound by a defense treaty with the Philippines, could be dragged into a direct conflict with China.

item.title: 'Wasteful spending': Prince Harry, Meghan Markle's Colombia tour cost revealed
item.description: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's four-day visit to Colombia cost the country nearly £45,000, covering security and internal transportation. The couple paid for their own flights and accommodation. The total expenditure, which was Col$244,245,305 (£44,725.14), covered various aspects of the trip, including security and internal transportation throughout the trip. The total cost encompassed an eight-day period from August 12 to 19.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Woman starts two wildfires to flirt with firefighters
item.description: A woman from Tripoli, Greece, has been convicted for intentionally setting two wildfires to flirt with firefighters. She received a three-year suspended prison sentence and a €1,000 fine. The fire department quickly controlled the blazes, which is critical given the severe wildfire outbreaks in Greece during August 2024.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Female teacher shot dead in Pakistan for refusing marriage proposal
item.description: A female teacher, aged 40, was fatally shot in front of her father after declining a marriage proposal in Buner, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa. The suspect escaped. This tragic event highlights an increasing crime trend in Pakistan, including recent 'honour' killings where women were murdered for marrying against their families' wishes.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Doesn’t give a s**t about them': Donald Trump's nephew Fred Trump blasts uncle over military disrespect
item.description: Fred Trump III, nephew of former US President Donald Trump, criticized his uncle on MSNBC's "Deadline: White House" for lacking empathy towards the military. He highlighted Trump's past remarks about late Senator John McCain and suggested that Trump's indifference to the armed forces is genuine and deeply ingrained, driven by self-interest.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US elections: Campaign launched to increase participation of Indian-Americans in polls
item.description: The Foundation for India and Indian Diaspora Studies (FIIDS) has launched the 'Indo American Votes Matter' campaign to increase the policy impact and participation of Indian-American voters in the upcoming US presidential elections. With around 4.5 million Indo-Americans concentrated in key swing states, their votes could significantly influence election outcomes.

item.title: 'Painful to watch': Biden leaves reporters hanging amid question blitz; team Trump shares video
item.description: President Joe Biden faced criticism for not answering reporters' questions during a recent White House event. After concluding his remarks on the 'Investing in America' agenda, which included job creation and economic growth, he remained silent for a minute while reporters shouted questions. Biden then left the room with his staff without addressing the inquiries.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 4 Indians killed in Texas crash
item.description: In Anna city, Texas, four Indians died when their SUV burst into flames following a multi-vehicle crash involving a speeding truck. The victims were Aryan Raghunath Orampati, Farooq Shaik, Lokesh Palacharla, and Darshini Vasudevan. Authorities are conducting DNA fingerprinting to confirm their identities as the bodies were charred beyond recognition.
item.dc:creator: U Sudhakar Reddy

item.title: Government reshuffle in Ukraine: Key ministers step down amid conflict with Russia
item.description: In Ukraine, a significant government reshuffle occurred with key ministers resigning amid the ongoing conflict with Russia. President Zelenskyy aims to fill these positions before his US visit to present a 'victory plan' to President Biden. This reshuffle is crucial for strengthening Ukraine's state institutions during the important autumn season.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Sharif: Hopeful of bailout approval by IMF board
item.description: Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif revealed that Pakistan is actively implementing the IMF's conditions for a $7-billion loan agreement secured in July. The government has introduced measures to enhance tax collection and revenue, including a tax-heavy budget and higher energy tariffs. Sharif expressed optimism about gaining approval from the IMF's executive board.
item.dc:creator: Omer Farooq Khan

item.title: Jailbreak bid leaves 129 dead at Congo prison
Cathay finds 15 planes need engine repairs
Korean staple kimchi faces climate threat
US justice department charges Hamas leaders over deadly October 7 attack on Israel
item.description: The US justice department has charged Yahya Sinwar and other key Hamas figures for their roles in the October 7, 2023 attack on Israel. Accusations include conspiracy to support terrorism and murder of US citizens. Despite challenges in apprehending them, this action aims to hold Hamas accountable for decades of alleged attacks.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 5 children arrested for murder after 80-year-old British-Indian dog walker attacked in park
item.dc:creator: Naomi Canton

item.title: What's so special about Kamala Harris' tan suit that Obama's didn't have
item.description: Kamala Harris donned a tan suit at the Democratic National Convention, mirroring Barack Obama's controversial fashion choice from ten years ago. While Obama's suit faced criticism, Harris's decision is interpreted as a confident statement. Obama too took note how his tan suit got a makeover and made a reappearance through Harris.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump says he'd release Jeffrey Epstein files: 'Fortunately, I was not...'
item.description: "He (Epstein) was a good salesman. He was a hale and hearty type of a guy. He had some nice assets that he'd throw around like islands. But a lot of big people went to that island. But fortunately I was not one of them," Trump said adding that Kennedy files are very different from Epstein files but he would be inclined to release the latter as well as he has no problem.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Nepal plans to issue new banknotes featuring disputed territories with India within a year: Report
item.description: Nepal's central bank is proceeding with plans to print new banknotes featuring a revised map that includes disputed territories with India, such as Kalapani, Lipulekh, and Limpiyadhura. This initiative follows a cabinet decision led by former Prime Minister Pushpa Kamal Dahal 'Prachanda' and aims for completion within six months to one year.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kash Patel predicts major power grid attack in US before election: 'Something's gonna happen'
item.description: Kash Patel, an ex-Trump administration official, has forecasted a major power grid attack in the US coinciding with the election cycle. Speaking on a podcast, he said the intel community right now is playing catch up on half these attacks because it wasn't a priority to preemptively detect them and thwart the attack.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
